alert.note: Alert for St Lawrence Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 09 at 1:19AM AKST until December 09 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Additional snow accumulations of 4 inches. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. Winds gusting to 60 mph. Freezing spray will form a thin glaze along north facing shores such as at Savoonga. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong north winds will cause snow squalls with periods of very low visibility through Saturday. The winds combined with temperatures in the teens will cause freezing spray to accumulate into a light glaze along north facing shores such as at Savoonga through Saturday. Winds are expected to decrease Saturday afternoon and blowing snow and freezing spray will diminish then. Gale force north winds are expected to return Sunday night and continue into Wednesday which will bring a return to snow squalls and blowing snow with low visibility, along with freezing spray at Savoonga.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
